Package gameobjects.nonstaticobjects

Class NonStaticObject

java.lang.Object
gameobjects.GameObject
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.NonStaticObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GroundItem, Hero, Monster, Tear
public abstract class NonStaticObject
extends GameObject
A NonStaticObject is a GameObject that as the special ability of being able to move. It uses some unique variable such as a Vector2 for the direction the object will go, a double speed used to know fast the object will travel in the given direction.

There also are two important variable, double health which indicate how much health the object has, and double damage that represents how much health the GameObject will damage other objects.

The last variables are the integer animationState that indicate what state of animation the object is in, the others are boolean, one named dead used to know if the object is dead, and isHit to know if the object as been hit. To check what the other variable from NonStaticObject are please refer to GameObject.

See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • NonStaticObject

      public NonStaticObject​(Vector2 position, Vector2 size, java.lang.String imagePath, @Nullable Room room, double speed, double damage, double health)
      Constructs a new NonStaticObject, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument, whose room is specified by the Room argument, and whose item is specified by the Item argument.

      Note that if you want to create a object that does not deal damage to anything, you just have to create it with damage = 0.

      Parameters:
      position - the position of the new NonStaticObject
      size - the size of the new GroundItem
      imagePath - the image of the new NonStaticObject
      room - the room the new GroundItem will be in
      speed - the speed of the new NonStaticObject
      damage - the damage of the new NonStaticObject
      health - the health of the new NonStaticObject
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - unless both position and size aren't null

  • Method Details

    • animation

      public abstract void animation()
      Not used in this class, but it's used in many other NonStaticObject, to see example of the used check Tear.animation() or Hero.animation().

    • isHitCooldown

      public int isHitCooldown()
      Changes the hit cooldown by decreasing it by 1, except when it reaches 0 where it stops and sets the Color to null.
      Returns:
      the new value assigned to cooldownisHit.

    • loseHealth

      public void loseHealth​(double damage)
      Retrieves a amount of damage from the objects health. If the health is greater than the maxHealth then it set the health to the maxHealth.
      Parameters:
      damage - the amount of damage you want the object to receive.

    • getNormalizedDirection

      public Vector2 getNormalizedDirection()
      Normalizes the direction vector linked to the object.
      Returns:
      a normalized direction direction.

    • legalMove

      public boolean legalMove​(Vector2 position)
      Checks if the move is legal, it's legal if the position does not collide with any wall, or any door, or any solid StaticObject.

      To check how two hitboxes are colliding, refer to HitBox.

      Returns a boolean, true if it's legal, false otherwise.

      Parameters:
      position - , object position
      Returns:
      true if the move is legal, false otherwise.

    • SetIsHit

      public void SetIsHit​(boolean isHit)
      Sets the state of hit, whether it's hit or not.

      if isHit is true then on top of setting the value to the wanted one, it will also set the Color to red, and starts a isHit timer.

      Parameters:
      isHit - the hit state you want the NonStaticObject

    • SetIsHitValue

      public void SetIsHitValue​(boolean isHit)
      Sets the state of hit, whether it's hit or not.
      Parameters:
      isHit - the hit state you want the NonStaticObject

    • getHealth

      public double getHealth()
      Returns the Health of the NonStaticObject.
      Returns:
      the health of the NonStaticObject.

    • setHealth

      public void setHealth​(double health)
      Sets the health of the NonStaticObject. It doesn't change the max health value.
      Parameters:
      health - the new health of the NonStaticObject

    • getDead

      public boolean getDead()
      Returns the state of death of the NonStaticObject.

      true if the NonStaticObject is dead, {code false} otherwise.

    • setDead

      public void setDead​(boolean dead)
      Set the state of death of the NonStaticObject. If dead is true then the NonStaticObject is considered dead, if dead is false then the NonStaticObject is considered alive.
      Parameters:
      dead - the state of death of the NonStaticObject
